department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: Upgrade of the pumphouse and saltwater intakes at the Fisheries and Oceans Canada – Pacific Science Enterprise Centre (PSEC) facility.
description: Work under this Contract comprises general construction of: Three (3) new saltwater intakes, A new intake manifold on the foreshore to combine the three intakes into two (2) supply (or “inlet”) pipes before the marine intake pumphouse, Two (2) vertical turbine pumps to replace the existing pumps installed within the existing sump manhole of the existing pumphouse, which connect to the two incoming supply pipes, Integration and re-connection of all existing pipes, associated electrical and control conduits and connections, including the municipal water flushing lines that connect to the intakes prior to entering the pumphouse, piping and fittings associated with the pumps, existing drainage infrastructure surrounding the pumphouse and intake area, and electrical conduits on the south wall of the pumphouse.

### Description of Work
The scope of this contract involves upgrading the saltwater intake and pumphouse at the Fisheries and Oceans Canada – Pacific Science Enterprise Centre (PSEC) facility. The work will consist of:

* Construction of three new saltwater intakes
* Installation of a new intake manifold to combine the three intakes into two supply pipes
* Replacement of existing pumps with two new vertical turbine pumps
* Integration of existing pipes, electrical and control conduits, and connections
* Reconnection of municipal water flushing lines and associated piping
* Installation of drainage infrastructure surrounding the pumphouse and intake area
* Installation of electrical conduits on the south wall of the pumphouse
